articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Israel's widely expected ground invasion of Lebanon appeared to be getting underway early on Tuesday as its military said troops had begun 'limited' raids against Hezbollah targets in the border area.
articles.title: Israel's Lebanon ground invasion begins with 'limited' raids on Hezbollah

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 21 people in Gaza on Tuesday, local medics said and fighting ramped up, as the Israeli military said it had been targeting command centres used by its Islamist militant foe Hamas.
articles.title: Israeli bombardment kills at least 21 in Gaza as fighting rages

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Steve Holland
articles.description: The United States has indications that Iran is preparing to imminently launch a ballistic missile attack against Israel that could be at least as large as a strike that Tehran staged earlier this year, U.S. officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: US has indications Iran preparing to launch ballistic missile attack on Israel, White House official says

articles.author: Andrew Hay, Daniel Trotta
articles.description: North Carolina will resume search and rescue operations on Tuesday, intent on delivering aid and making contact with hundreds of people cut off by washed-out roads and damaged cellphone towers in the wake of Helene.
articles.title: North Carolina searches for survivors cut off by Hurricane Helene

articles.author: David Alire Garcia
articles.description: When Claudia Sheinbaum takes her oath of office on Tuesday, formally becoming Mexico's first woman president, she will adopt a new government logo that nods to the aspirations of young girls.
articles.title: Mexico's Sheinbaum takes office, making history as first woman president

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: NATO's new chief Mark Rutte voiced strong support for Ukraine on Tuesday and said he was not worried about the upcoming U.S. election as he could work with former President Donald Trump or Vice President Kamala Harris.
articles.title: New NATO boss Rutte pledges support for Ukraine, plays down Trump fears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: About 25 people were feared dead in Thailand on Tuesday when a school bus carrying students and teachers on a field trip caught fire on the outskirts of the capital Bangkok, with 16 passengers hospitalised, the government said.
articles.title: School bus catches fire in Thailand, 25 feared dead

articles.author: Lucila Sigal, Javier Corbalan
articles.description: In Argentina's poor barrios a food emergency is taking hold as poverty rises, with malnutrition on the increase and medics treating children for eye diseases and even scurvy linked to a vitamin-deficient diet.
articles.title: In Argentina's poverty-hit barrios a food emergency takes hold

articles.author: Emilie Madi
articles.description: The repeated blasts in Beirut's southern suburbs where Israel has been carrying out airstrikes this week have driven Zeina Nazha and her young daughter to camp on a city beach seeking safety from the war in Lebanon.
articles.title: As Israeli jets hit Beirut, people flee to sleep on the beach

articles.author: John Geddie, Tim Kelly
articles.description: Shigeru Ishiba was set to be voted in by parliament as Japan's next prime minister on Tuesday and unveil his cabinet as he seeks to heal party divisions and prepare for an Oct. 27 snap election.
articles.title: Japan's new PM Ishiba set to be formally anointed, unveil cabinet
